|cable serv 1= [[SkyCable]] |cable chan 1= Channel 14 |cable serv 2= [[Global Destiny Cable]] |cable chan 2= Channel 14 |cable serv 3= [[Royal Cable]] |cable chan 3= Santa Rosa City, Channel 9 |cable serv 4= [[Cable Star Iloilo]] |cable chan 4= Iloilo City, Channel 42 |cable serv 5= [[Cablelink]] |cable chan 5= Channel 12 |sat serv 1= [[G Sat]] |sat chan 1= Channel 5 |sat serv 2= [[Cignal Digital TV]] |sat chan 2= Channel 9 |sat serv 3= [[Dream Satellite TV]] |sat chan 3= Channel 6 |online serv 1= Available thru ''myTV'' services from [[Smart Communications]] |online chan 1= Capable for 3G mobile phone handsets with [[DVB-H]] }} '''ETC Entertainment Central''' is a [[Philippine]] [[television]] [[Television channel|channel]] produced and founded by Solar Entertainment Corporation which also created its sister stations, [[Solar TV]], [[Universal Channel (Philippines)|Universal Channel]], [[Diva Universal (Philippines)|Diva Universal]], [[2nd Avenue]], [[Jack TV]], [[Basketball TV]], & [[Solar Sports]]. It is currently available over the ''Philippine FREE-TV'' after it had been pulled out from the cable TV, although it is still being aired via [[SkyCable]] & [[Global Destiny Cable]] channel 14, [[G Sat]] TV channel 4, [[Cablelink]] 12, Smart myTV and other affiliate cable companies in the Philippines. It features [[talk shows]], [[dating|dating shows]], [[sitcoms]], [[drama|drama series]], [[reality shows]] and [[entertainment]] [[news]] from the ''United States''. ETC sponsors other events, particularly parties around the [[Metro Manila|Metro Manila area]] . These events are previously seen on [[Rated Oh!]], They also promote upcoming movies.{{citation needed|date=October 2008}} As of January 1, 2008 ETC ceased to air over SkyCable as a channel on its own right. However, as part of block-time agreements with various terrestrial channels, ETC carries some of its programs over [[Southern Broadcasting Network|SBN 21]], a terrestrial [[UHF]] [[TV]] Station in Metro Manila and selected cities in the Philippines. By March 2, 2011, ETC will move to [[Radio Philippines Network|RPN]] while SBN 21 changes to [[Talk TV (Philippines)|Talk TV]].[http://www.philstar.com/funfare/Article.aspx?articleId=660792&publicationSubCategoryId=70 ETC on RPN-9 starting March 2] retrieved via www.philstar.com 02-25-2011[http://www.manilastandardtoday.com/insideBusop.htm?f=2011/february/25/vicagustin.isx&d=2011/february/25 Tiengs move into news] Manila Standard Today. 02-25-2011. Retrieved 02-25-2011.[http://www.clickthecity.com/tv/?p=10622 ETC Moves To RPN-9 on March 2] retrieved via www.clickthecity.com 02-28-2011 ==Programming== {{main|List of programs broadcast by ETC}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.etc.com.ph/ ETC official website] *[http://www.facebook.com/etctv ETC on Facebook] *[http://www.twitter.com/etc_Channel ETC on Twitter] {{Television in the Philippines}} {{Programs}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Etc Entertainment Central}} [[Category:Philippine television networks]] [[Category:Solar Entertainment Corporation]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 2004]]
